name: IBSRELA

indications.text: ibsrela indicated treatment irritable bowel syndrome constipation ( ibs-c ) adults .

contraindications.text: recommended ibsrela adults 50 mg orally twice daily .

warningsAndPrecautions: ibsrela tablets contain 50 mg tenapanor oval , white off-white , debossed `` 50 `` one side `` 5791 `` side . ibsrela supplied white , opaque , high-density polyethylene bottle containing 60 tablets silica gel canister ( desiccant ) screw-top polypropylene child-resistant cap lined induction-activated aluminum foil liner ( ndc 73154-050-60 ) .
adverseReactions: ibsrela contraindicated : patients less 6 years age due risk serious dehydration [ ( 5.1 ) , ( 8.4 ) ] . patients known suspected mechanical gastrointestinal obstruction .
indications_original: IBSRELA is indicated for treatment of irritable bowel syndrome with constipation (IBS-C) in adults.
contraindications_original: The recommended dosage of IBSRELA in adults is 50 mg orally twice daily.
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
IBSRELA tablets contain 50 mg tenapanor and are oval, white to off-white, debossed with "50" on one side and "5791" on the other side.
                  IBSRELA is supplied in a white, opaque, high-density polyethylene bottle containing 60 tablets with a silica gel canister (as the desiccant) and screw-top polypropylene child-resistant cap lined and induction-activated aluminum foil liner (NDC 73154-050-60).
adverseReactions_original:
IBSRELA is contraindicated in:
                  
                     Patients less than 6 years of age due to the risk of serious dehydration [see Warnings and Precautions (5.1), Use in Specific Populations (8.4)].
                     
                     Patients with known or suspected mechanical gastrointestinal obstruction.
